Title.evidence: Carotid Revascularization Endarterectomy versus Stenting Trial (CREST): A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to either CAS or CEA.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial included 2,502 patients with carotid artery stenosis.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to either CAS or CEA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the periprocedural S+D rate, assessed over a 30-day period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the interventions.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1,251 patients were randomised to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: For lesions â‰¥12.85 mm, CAS had a higher S+D risk than CEA (OR = 3.42; 95% CI, 1.19-9.78).
